path: ./Audit_Reports_2024/QuillAudits/Carpe Diem Savings Smart Contract Audit Report - QuillAudits.pdf

findings.title: Tautology or contradiction
findings.description: A tautology or contradiction exists in the contract's logic.

findings.title: Return values of low-level calls
findings.description: The audit report highlights the potential issue of not properly handling return values from low-level calls, which can lead to unexpected behavior or security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Private modifier
findings.description: Most of the constants can be made private instead of public.

findings.title: Using block.timestamp
findings.description: The usage of block.timestamp can make the contract vulnerable to timestamp manipulation attacks.

findings.title: State Variable are written after the external call
findings.description: If the token safeTransferFrom or safeTransfer is malicious then the reentrancy can be created in Carpediem.upgradeStake, Carpediem.distributePenalty, Carpediem.deposit.

findings.title: Used Locked Pragma Version
findings.description: The pragma versions used in the contract are not locked, which can cause confusion for developers and lead to compilation issues.
